hint.text: Polynomials in three variable have \(3\,\) different variables.

solution.text:
\(x^{_{j}_} + y^{_{k}_} + z + _{l}_\,\) has three variables \(x,\,y\,\) and \(z.\)
\(_{k}_p^{_{j}_} + _{l}_q^{_{k}_} + _{j}_r^{_{l}_}\,\) also has three variables \(p,\,q\,\) and \(r.\)
\(t^{_{{j+3}}_}+t\,\) and \(_{j}_a^{_{m}_} + _{k}_b^{_{n}_} + _{l}_b^{_{o}_}\,\) have only one and two variables respectively.
